languages.custom: Understands all languages it knew in life but can’t speak

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 3d6 type=force average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The poltergeist targets a creature or unattended object within 30 feet of it. A creature must be Medium or smaller to be affected by this magic, and an object can weigh up to 150 pounds.

If the target is a creature, the poltergeist makes a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} check contested by the target’s &Reference[str]{Strength} check. If the poltergeist wins the contest, the poltergeist hurls the target up to 30 feet in any direction, including upward. If the target then comes into contact with a hard surface or heavy object, the target takes 1d6 damage per 10 feet moved.

If the target is an object that isn’t being worn or carried, the poltergeist hurls it up to 30 feet in any direction. The poltergeist can use the object as a ranged weapon, attacking one creature along the object’s path (+4 to hit) and dealing [[/damage 2d4 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage on a hit.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Incorporeal Movement. The poltergeist can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes [[/damage 1d10 type=force average=true]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the poltergeist has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Invisibility. The poltergeist is &Reference[invisible]{invisible}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
